text: Sir Murray Gordon Halberg (born 7 July 1933) is a New Zealand former middle- distance runner. He was born in Eketahuna. He won the gold medal in the 5000 metres event at the 1960 Summer Olympics. He also won gold medals in the 3 miles events at the 1958 and 1962 Commonwealth Games. In 1963, he set up the Halberg Trust, which supports children with disabilities to be active in sport, creation and leisure. The organisation rebranded in 2012 to become the Halberg Disability Sport Foundation. ==References== ==Other websites== *Murray Halberg at Sports-Reference.com Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:New Zealand athletes Category:Middle-distance runners Category:Members of the Order of the British Empire Category:Olympic gold medalists for New Zealand Category:Sportspeople from North Island
